topic.title: Why IFS isn't used more?
topic.body: Yes, of course, [**IFS**](http://127.0.0.1:43110/12MVkvYGcRW6u2NYbpfwVad1oQeyG4s9Er) doesn't accept porn or CP, but is very usefull for small file like song, pdf, retrogames ROMs or similiar (in some cases, better than ZeroUP) .

topic.title: Direct file send
topic.body:
Hi guys.
There is any service that permit to send files directly to another user (by knowing his ZeroID) ? 
Something like [ZeroMail](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Mail.ZeroNetwork.bit/), but with the attachments. 
Thanks!

topic.title: Pedo4Crypto - The first shop on ZeroNet
topic.body:
Hi guys, I've opened the first shop on ZeroNet: [**Pedo4Crypto**](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1AZqKMVzsH1Q3soYdoRMJPzcV8Lah4Xyhu/?wrapper_nonce=e6c9423a5b93d535336844449270c01a792091eba243bdf59587e939719874cc&wrapper_nonce=45286e4a447b3f8ed11c95094db6be9315dd4aa56487733014186de97a562c28) .
In this site, you can buy CP for less than $ 0.01 for photo.
I accept BTC, LTC, DASH and DOGE .
The service is really rudimentary, but is a start.
The first that write me on ZeroMail with **_pedo4me_** as subject, will receive 2 free preview.

Enjoy!

1518574627_19WW28sn46rz9h15xf6NCELPdzxZ2.body:
In my opinion, you are simply looking at things from the wrong point of view: it is true, the world is full of injustice, creativity is oppressed and the government is invasive. But it could not be otherwise. Human beings, for the most part, are stupid and chaotic beings, devoid of any spirit (without religious or mystical references) or ability to rise up.
The society to which you aspire (which is the same to which I also aspire, to be sincere), is a society capable of functioning only with individuals endowed with creativity, intelligence, spirit and the ability to rise. With the "mass", the "vulgar", which by its nature is self-destructive and lacking the necessary skills to understand what is necessary for a proper functioning of civilization, such a society would result in a catastrophe: continuous wars, even abuse worse than the current ones, and the loss of everything that differentiates us from the "beasts".

The alternative, no matter how bad it is, is not: if someone feels superior and different from all of this, he will be forced to live almost certainly relegated to an elité of individuals who have decided not to approve themselves.
> just to wake this country up
It is useless to try to wake up the world (or even just your country): they are all in a coma.
The only thing to do is to look at society from above, using it for its own purposes when possible, and laughing and distancing itself from it when it is not possible.

This was my opinion, then, everyone thinks what he wants.

1518794232_1EauY5Qr9U4YF4JCq8VDnfh6guT75.body:
I like Freenet, there is a lot of interesting stuff. 
The major problem, is that it offers no control on what you share, while ZeroNet does .
On the other hand, on Freenet you find many more sites than Zeronet, even if it is growing fast, and, on average, the quality is higher (eg There are no blogs created and then left to rot unnecessarily, as well as, in the most of the cases, there are no "test" and "Hello World!" posts ...).

However, one point against it (to the detriment of Freenet) is that it is terribly slower than ZeroNet (as it has already said **@helium** )

1519134874_1GggviVybPzMm71pGAKvCF1jihPNS.body:
You can't use ZeroNet to connect to the clearnet (the other Internet, eg. google.com), 'cause it is meant to be isolated from the rest of the Internet.
If you want to browse web anonymously, I recommend you [Tor](https://www.torproject.org/) or a VPN (my favourite is [ProtonVPN](https://protonvpn.com/)).

1519658352_195Xafx3aZsxtngKo7D3XWgByQ5rY.body: Not natively, but you can use your browser search function, like in all other web sites: in Chrome and Firefox, you can use it by pressing F3 or CTRL + F

> [kaffie](#comment_593_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): I was actually working on a search engine for this, lol. I went ahead and published the demo code here. That should let you search through via: file title, filename, uploader, file type, and uploader auth_address. Expect bugs and lots of unpolished stuff. [...]
Really usefull. Thanks !

1523299159_1KhyYzD37jfRrvr5p5biqc3ccjfQe.body:
Mmmh... The only really working method is with a bruteforcing (e.g. with aircrack-ng).

If you are lucky, the network could be vulnerable to a [KRACK attack](https://www.krackattacks.com/) <-- (**clearnet**) . I suggest to try this first, because is really faster than bruteforcing .

1523176273_1467X2hmPQP5gAKnh9uhQX6M1DWCH.body:
First of all, remember this:
* **Privacy** : everybody know who you are, nobody know what you do;
* **Anonymity** : Nobody know who you are, everybody know what you do;

ZeroNet, by itself, doesn't protect your privacy or anonymity more than clearnet, 'cause is just a P2P network . 
You can protect your anonymity by using Tor/I2P (if is supported, I don't know...) to hide your IP and use Tor Browser to browsing the content . 
In this way, neither your privacy nor your anonymity are in danger . 

The content is public, but nobody can connect your business on ZeroNet to your real identity (theoretically) .
As regards the censorship, however, Intelligence agencies can't obscure or censor any content for an intrinsic property of P2P networks like ZeroNet.
The common web is surrected by a client-server model: you (client) make a request for a content to another PC (server) where the content is stored . If  the FBI obscure the server, you can't access to the content anymore.
But if every client that downloads the content becomes a server, the content would be offered by multiple PCs at the same time.
For example: if a photo is hosted on a P2P network, and it has 1000 peer, the FBI can obscure one or two of these, but not all at the same time, so the photo remain accessible . If the original peer goes offline, there is other 999 that can offer the content. 

I hope I have answered your question :)

> [km199](#comment_8_1467X2hmPQP5gAKnh9uhQX6M1DWCHqLbCG): How do you make a new account?

Just remove your users.json files (it should be in ```ZeroBundle/ZeroNet/data```) and register a new certificate by using [ZeroID](http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeroid.bit/) or your favorite service . Remember that if you delete your actually users.json file, you lost your actual identity on ZeroNet, and there is no way to recover it .

> [thunder33345](#comment_2_1AHEQxyRG9s6owyJHShB4U4rg9GL5FMX5K): thanks but any more streamlined ways? [...]

It seems that you already know the answer... Is this a test ?!? XD
Anyway, you basically have to rename the ```ZeroBundle/ZeroNet/plugins/disabled-Multiuser``` directory to ```ZeroBundle/ZeroNet/plugins/Multiuser```, restart ZeroNet and then login by using the ```master_seed``` value from your users.json file . Then you have to visit [ZeroID](http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeroid.bit/) to get a new certificate. More info on [Reddit](https://www.reddit.com/r/zeronet/comments/3xi5ss/changing_identities/) (**clearnet**) .

1525698971_126w3qujTWkNgjDDZQ7Evq46ZkLkA.body: Thanks for the answer, I think I will use [IPFS](), as suggested by **@altezza** or a password-protected file on [0-share](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Dphm8Mth9WYN9fPm1yxj8Y4WhcKRhYXJJ), as suggested by  **@ssdifnskdjfnsdjk** and **@pq9p** .

and "we" instead of "they"

Sorry, I'm not a native English speaker and often I commit these errors.

1536111056_1Br6u3XGUK1cnNf4A35jksjJKHNLk.body: you need to cd into ```ZeroBundle/ZeroNet``` directory, then ```./zeronet.py siteCreate ``` .

> [chronosx](#comment_2_16pxiaoNXcNAdLju8iVMoVyg4aJvQdXfEC): or python2 zeronet.py siteCreate

Of course, but at the begin of ```zeronet.py``` file there is a shebang ```#!/usr/bin/env python2.7```, so specify python2, in this case, is useless
